attributes.action: Introduce more education and training in law history to the RCJ Judicial college
attributes.additional_details: The Lord Chancellor & Lord Chief Justice direct the Judicial conduct investigation office & play important roles in the Judicial college within the Royal Courts of Justice.  We have a right to demand & suggest improvements in the quality and quantity of education that Ministry of Justice staff, royal Officers, Judges and Magistrates and case workers recieve.
attributes.background: The Judicial college that trains Judges and Magistrates within the Royal Courts of Justice is not educating them with enough law history,  particularly Rights and law around petitioning and the establishment of courts and parliament. understanding the origins and history is fundamental to law study

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about matter the Government or House of Commons are responsible for.

The Judicial College is independent of Government, so decisions about their courses is a matter for them, not the Government or House of Commons.
